macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US stocks mixed as tech leads gains; Nasdaq jumps over 1%
items.summary: Major US indexes were mixed on Thursday with the Nasdaq Composite rallying about 1.4% while the Dow rose modestly and small-caps lagged, driven by strength in megacap tech names ahead of key earnings and economic data releases, according to market reports covering Dec. 18 trading activity.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin slips after failed breakout; $23B of options set to expire next week
items.summary: Bitcoin tested the $90k level then sold off ~5.5% after a failed breakout, contributing to elevated volatility across markets; roughly $23 billion of BTC options are due to expire next Friday which market participants warn could amplify moves.[1][2]

items.title: SoFi Bank launches USD stablecoin (SoFiUSD) on Ethereum — first U.S. national bank to do so
items.summary: SoFi Bank issued SoFiUSD, a 1:1 cash-reserved USD stablecoin now live on Ethereum and positioned for use by banks, fintech firms and enterprise partners; reporting notes SoFi plans to open access to its retail users later.[2]

items.title: U.S. crypto bill (CLARITY Act) nearing Senate review, White House adviser says
items.summary: David Sacks, White House head of AI and crypto affairs, said the bipartisan CLARITY Act is closer to formal legislation and is expected to be reviewed and revised in the Senate in January, signaling potential near-term U.S. regulatory action.[2]

items.title: Synthetix returns to Ethereum mainnet and launches perpetual DEX
items.summary: Synthetix announced it has returned to the Ethereum mainnet after three years and launched a perpetual contract DEX on mainnet, with an incentive program slated for Q1 next year.[3]

items.title: Circle launches Arc L1 builder fund to accelerate RWA and enterprise use cases
items.summary: Circle announced an Arc L1 blockchain builder fund aimed at growing an Ecosystem around USDC and Real-World Asset (RWA) primitives, positioning Circle beyond stablecoin issuance toward an 'Economic Operating System'.[1]

items.title: Market movers: LDO listed on Robinhood; ZEC sees node software update
items.summary: Robinhood listed LDO for spot trading, contributing to LDO gains, while the Zcash Foundation released Zebra 3.1.0 to improve node performance, supporting ZEC price strength.[1]

items.title: Exchange flows and product updates: Coinbase launches custom stablecoin service; US XRP spot ETF records inflows
items.summary: Coinbase launched a customized stablecoin service (with R2 selected among early ecosystem projects), while reports indicate the U.S. XRP spot ETF saw a net inflow of $30.41M in a single day.[3]

items.title: Industry view: Grayscale and Circle highlight stablecoin growth and USDC dominance
items.summary: Grayscale projected explosive stablecoin growth by 2025 and Circle-related reporting continues to highlight USDC's central role in transaction volumes and RWA infrastructure development.[6][5]

items.title: U.S. SEC flags Bitcoin miner hosting as potential securities offering
items.summary: The SEC has asserted in litigation that third-party Bitcoin mining hosting services may fall under securities laws, a regulatory stance that could affect miner business models and hosting relationships.[9]

items.title: Price snapshot: Market down ~1–1.1% with BTC near mid-$80k and ETH ~$2,800
items.summary: Multiple market reports show the global crypto market declined around 1–1.1% in the past 24 hours, Bitcoin trading in the mid-$80k range (~$85–87k) and Ethereum around $2.8k amid 'Extreme Fear' sentiment readings.[4][1]

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Red Hat Acquires Chatterbox Labs to Boost AI Trust and Security
items.summary: Red Hat acquired Chatterbox Labs, a specialist in AI safety and generative AI guardrails, integrating model-agnostic security tools into its AI portfolio for trustworthy enterprise deployments. The move supports production-grade AI in hybrid cloud environments with automated risk metrics.

items.title: TCS Launches TCS BaNCS AI Compass for Banking Innovation
items.summary: Tata Consultancy Services unveiled TCS BaNCS AI Compass, integrating machine learning, deep learning, generative AI, and pre-built agents to optimize banking operations, provide actionable insights, and enhance risk management. Zions Bancorporation praised its potential for efficiency and risk control.

items.title: NSFOCUS AI Agent Capabilities Recognized by Forrester Report
items.summary: Forrester included NSFOCUS in its report on China's AI agent ecosystem, highlighting trends like DeepSeek breakthroughs, multi-agent systems, RAG improvements, and open-source development. NSFOCUS's AI agents advance cybersecurity with noise reduction, threat reasoning, and faster detection/response times.

items.title: Red Hat Expands AI Collaboration with AWS for Scalable Gen AI
items.summary: Red Hat is optimizing its AI platforms for AWS Trainium and Inferentia chips to enable enterprises to scale production-ready generative AI across hybrid clouds. This builds on commitments to open ecosystems and 2026 priorities like agentic AI and infrastructure modernization.

items.title: AI Infrastructure Demands Surge with Massive Investments Needed
items.summary: Major tech leaders confirm tens to hundreds of billions in infrastructure investment required for AI competitiveness, amid rising energy/water demands of data centers and inference costs rivaling training. Companies shift from 'AGI' terminology while advancing reasoning capabilities and healthcare deployments.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Epic Games Store Holiday 2025: Jotunslayer: Hordes of Hel Free December 18-19
items.summary: Jotunslayer: Hordes of Hel, a Vampire Survivors-style game set in the Viking age, is the latest free title on Epic Games Store's Holiday 2025 giveaway, available only until December 19. The promotion continues with daily free games through early 2026.

items.title: Epic Games Store Reveals Next Holiday Free Game: Jotunslayer: Hordes of Hel
items.summary: The second free game in Epic's Holiday 2025 event is Jotunslayer: Hordes of Hel, claimable from December 18 to 19 following Hogwarts Legacy. Users must claim before the next title drops at 8 AM PT on December 19.

items.title: Lost Tork Prototype for Game Boy Advance Recovered and Released
items.summary: A long-lost prototype of Tork, a cancelled Game Boy Advance conversion, has been recovered from Archer Maclean's archives and made available. The update highlights preservation efforts for unreleased games.

items.title: Dropzone Game Boy Prototypes from 1992 Released Publicly
items.summary: Two late prototypes of Dropzone for the original Game Boy, dated October 23 and November 3, 1992, have been recovered and shared as part of a Christmas update from Archer Maclean's backups.

items.title: Fortnite Ballistic v37.10 Update Adds Veiled Precision SMG and Deployable Wall
items.summary: Fortnite's latest Ballistic update introduces the Veiled Precision SMG, Deployable Wall Gadget, and more competitive features. Winterfest 2025 event is also live with festive rewards.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: NVIDIA launches RTX PRO 5000 72GB Blackwell GPU and expands partnerships
items.summary: NVIDIA unveiled the RTX PRO 5000 72GB Blackwell GPU and announced expanded partnerships including co-development work on AI SSDs with SK hynix and supply agreements for next‑generation HBM4 memory with Samsung, strengthening its semiconductor ecosystem and R&D footprint.
items.source: Distill / Semiconductors & AI Chips weekly briefings

items.title: TSMC receives approval for major Phoenix expansion
items.summary: TSMC obtained approval for a significant manufacturing expansion in Phoenix, signaling continued investment in advanced semiconductor capacity outside Taiwan and increasing U.S. chip production footprint.

items.title: Samsung unveils Exynos 2600 (2nm) chipset with improved performance
items.summary: Samsung announced the Exynos 2600, produced on a 2nm process, which the company says delivers substantially improved performance targeted at flagship devices.

items.title: Intel installs first High‑NA EUV system
items.summary: Intel reported installation of its first High‑NA EUV lithography system, a step toward producing more advanced nodes and boosting its leading‑edge manufacturing capabilities.

items.title: Micron posts record quarterly results driven by memory demand
items.summary: Micron reported record fiscal results for Q1 FY2026, driven by strong demand in memory markets, reflecting continued strength in semiconductor component demand.

items.title: TSMC pioneers blue ammonia adoption to reduce supply‑chain emissions
items.summary: TSMC committed to reduce supply‑chain emissions by adopting blue ammonia as part of its sustainability strategy tied to its Phoenix expansion and broader manufacturing operations.

items.title: Qualcomm completes acquisition of Alphawave Semi
items.summary: Qualcomm finalized its acquisition of Alphawave Semi, expanding its portfolio in high‑speed connectivity and custom silicon for broader chip supply chain integration.

items.title: Solid‑state battery sector reaches pre‑industrialization tipping point
items.summary: Industry test results and production moves indicate solid‑state batteries are progressing from concept to pre‑industrial scale, with new production lines and prototype deliveries accelerating commercialization efforts.
items.source: SMM / Metal.com solid‑state battery weekly analysis

items.title: CiDi Inc. lists on Hong Kong Stock Exchange to bolster commercial autonomous driving
items.summary: CiDi Inc., a provider of intelligent driving solutions for commercial vehicles, completed its Main Board listing in Hong Kong, positioning itself to scale autonomous-driving deployments in closed and semi‑closed environments such as mining.

items.title: Elbit America recognized for Common Intelligent Display‑2 supply performance
items.summary: Elbit America received recognition from BAE Systems for its contribution to the Common Intelligent Display‑2 program, highlighting advances in ruggedized integrated display and computing systems for military vehicles.

summary:
Here is a concise executive briefing based on the provided raw news and market data:

1. **Market Overview**: The US stock market is mixed, with the Nasdaq Composite rallying about 1.4% and the Dow rising modestly. The crypto market is down around 1-1.1%, with Bitcoin trading in the mid-$80k range and Ethereum around $2.8k. Major cryptocurrencies such as Solana, Dogecoin, and Cardano have seen significant price movements, with Solana's price increasing by 0.88% and Dogecoin's price increasing by 1.56% in the last 24 hours.

2. **Tech & AI**: Notable tech developments include the launch of SoFiUSD, a 1:1 cash-reserved USD stablecoin on Ethereum, and the return of Synthetix to the Ethereum mainnet after three years. Additionally, Circle has launched an Arc L1 blockchain builder fund to accelerate Real-World Asset (RWA) and enterprise use cases. In AI news, Red Hat has acquired Chatterbox, and there have been significant developments in AI model releases, company announcements, and research breakthroughs.

3. **Gaming & Entertainment**: A digital museum of video game levels, Noclip.website, has been launched, allowing users to explore and interact with video game levels in a unique way.

4. **Key Insights**:
* The crypto market is experiencing increased volatility, with major price movements and regulatory developments on the horizon.
* The launch of SoFiUSD and Circle's Arc L1 blockchain builder fund signals growing interest in stablecoins and blockchain technology.
* AI developments, such as Red Hat's acquisition of Chatterbox, are driving innovation in the tech industry.
* The US stock market is mixed, with tech leading gains and small-caps lagging.
* Regulatory actions, such as the SEC's assertion that Bitcoin miner hosting services may fall under securities laws, may impact the crypto industry.

5. **Watch List**: 
* US crypto bill (CLARITY Act) nearing Senate review
* SoFiUSD and its impact on the stablecoin market
* Circle's Arc L1 blockchain builder fund and its potential to accelerate RWA and enterprise use cases
* Regulatory developments in the crypto industry, including the SEC's stance on Bitcoin miner hosting services
* AI model releases and company announcements, such as Red Hat's acquisition of Chatterbox.
